item.title: [HBASE-12286] [shell] Add server/cluster online load of configuration changes
item.description:
Add new loadConfig and loadConfig ServerName verbs to shell to expose new online loading of config changes.

This is last piece of a forward port of 0.89fb dynamic config feature done by Manukranth Kolloju

I'll do this last bit if no one else takes it up.

I have tested it on a local single node hbase instance. I am sure the failed tests weren't from my patch .

The change to hbase-site.xml is unintentional Manukranth Kolloju? If so I will leave it out on commit.

On the command names, you have update_rs_config and 'update_all_rs_config' and you take a 'host:port' arg.

What you think of one command named 'load_config' and if you do not pass a specific server, it loads all configs on the cluster? And rather than 'host:port', you pass it a 'servername' instead? If you look at help 'close_region', see how it takes a servername optionally. See 'move' how it takes a servername rather than a host:port. Ditto for hlog_roll.

If things like servername make no sense to you, and you want me to finish this patch up (you've done the hard part) doing above suggestions, just say.

update_rs_config without options seemed a little less intuitive for first time users. Most of the time, I enter the command without options to see help in shell. I felt people would do something like that and accidentally end up running the command. Shrinking it to 1 command was the first thought that came to my mind. I can make that change if that feels more natural/goes well with the flow. ServerName doesn't make so much sense here because the start code isn't something thats necessary for the command to be executed. Hence the thought. Giving ServerName would be a trivial change. And hbase-site.xml was my bad. I was testing on a local instance and that crept in, I didn't notice

Manukranth Kolloju ok on having two commands. Sounds good.

ServerName is probably more natural and aligned with how other commands run

The change to use servername maybe we should do too because looking at the Admin api, its

void updateConfiguration(ServerName server) throws IOException;

...and this patch is doing this:

@admin.updateConfiguration(ServerName.valueOf(hostAndPort, 0));

Looking at how HBaseAdmin implements updateConfiguration, will it work when startcode is 0?

Thanks Manukranth Kolloju

Updating the patch after cleaning it up as per stack's comments. stack, I think the server name with 0 as server code worked in my local tests. But, I am not sure whether it would work. I anyway feel that it would we coherent with the rest of the functions if it was servername. I am making that change here.
Patch lgtm. Will commit after hadoopqa run. Will add some 'help' on commit too. Nice one Manukranth Kolloju
stack, thanks for reviewing it closely.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Adds shell commands:

update_config 'servername'
update_all_config

These call new Admin methods added in HBASE-12147 to change server config. Only a small subset of configs are changeable without restart currently mostly to do with compaction configuration. See the refguide on dynamic configuration for a list.
